Name: Alabaster jar
Description: Alabaster jar with flat mouth and projecting collar, marked by a small but deep incision which serves as a neck, separating it from the body of the vase. The body is truncate cone-shaped and has two handles, rectangular in cross-section, which are placed symmetrically in a horizontal position. The base is flat. The surface of the jar is very well polished, both on the inside and on the outside.
